headline: Cucumber, Tomato, and Red Onion Salad
description: Cucumbers, tomatoes, and red onion are tossed with cilantro and lime juice in this cool and refreshing salad.
name: Cucumber, Tomato, and Red Onion Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Mix tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, cilantro, and lime juice together in a bowl. Season with salt and serve.

review.reviewBody: did not like it at all

This was great use of our summer CSA veggies! I made it exactly according to the recipe to start with. It did seem just a bit tame, so I added some red pepper flake… Shook a little like on pizza, toss, do it again, toss… Perfect!
Very easy and cool ;)

I made it and liked it. I never make a recipe exactly as it is written. I added feta, basil (because that was the fresh herb that I had)instead of cilantro, lemon instead of lime to go with the basil, and a bit of Italian Dressing. I sat it in the fridge for 30 minutes.
Will make it again. Loved it!
Definitely the best summer salad! I love that I didn’t have to add any oil. The flavors and colors just shout summer.

7.27.18 ... https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/188601/cucumber-tomato-and-red-onion-salad/ ... Very close to being too light. 'Definitely easy. Maybe more lime or crushed red pepper; or even freshly ground black pepper. :)
I made this recipe for our Family Reunion. It was a huge hit, everyone loved it. Adding the Cilantro really finished it off well.
Delicious I would make it again
I made this exactly as written. I felt it was missing something. A little bland, boring. Maybe it needed more salt. I did like the fact that it was essentially fat free.

2.19.18 So very simple, you really don't need a recipe for this. I did add a couple good cranks of freshly-ground pepper. You'll never go wrong with ingredients like this, and that lime juice just totally brightens the flavor and puts this quick and easy salad over the top!

My favorite east Indian restaurant makes this and I finally found the recipe on-line. I made this for dinner last night to accompany Butter Chicken and it was delicious! I didn't have red onion on hand so I used green onions and we still enjoyed it.
this is a salad I have been making all my life. I add freshly ground black pepper and olive oil. I also use dried mint instead of cilantro. All time fav at our house. (y)

Light and delicious on a hot summer day! I love pretty, colorful dishes, so I used Cherubs and Sunbursts (small yellow tomatoes). After peeling the cucumber, I scored lengthwise with a fork then cut lengthwise 4 times to slice quarters. Be sure to rip, not chop, the cilantro to preserve the beautiful leaves. And, I am a Spice Girl, so I added a variety of spices to my taste. Served in a glass bowl to show it off and it was a hit! I look forward to making it again as I want to experiment with variations. Thanks!
Very tasty salad. thank you !!!
Great summer salad. Easy and very tasty.

My husband made this for us with our veggies from the garden. He added a splash of balsamic vinegar & toasted sesame seeds! I'm addicted to it, by itself it is wonderful. On top of a plate of greens to make a fresh green salad is great, too (i use baby spinach). The juices combined with the vinegar make a delicious light dressing and it is so quick to put together! Thanks!
I made this exactly as written. I like that it uses fresh, real ingredients. It was good, just not
Oh yeah!!! Used black beans and Italian dressing!!! Scrumptious!!
I can't eat red onions, so I use Walla Walla Sweets or something similar. I also serve this as a dip with corn tortilla chips. LOVE it!
So simple and crazy good as-is! Great way to use summer farm stand fresh vegetables. Fun to customize too.

This was awesome! I was out of red onion, so I used white. Tasted fine, but would have been prettier with the red. I also diced all my veggies into uniform pieces, just because it's easier to eat that way. This was a great salad to have on a warm day - but definitely tastes tons better after it has sat over night or even two nights. Yum!
We made this exactly as it states, let it sit overnight and it was just awesome.
Absolutely delicious and refreshing! I am not a fan of raw tomatoes but had all of these ingredients on hand. I used juice of 2 limes, added a couple TB of Italian vinaigrette and feta.
Yummy but I had to add my own flare a bit

Made it exactly as directed, but cut up the pieces into "salsa-sized" so I could eat it as a dip rather than salad. Very good that day, much better the next day. Next time I will add a fair amount of crushed garlic. I think that will make it 5 stars.
A nice combination of my garden veggies.

I make this simple quick salad all the time. Fresh lime is a the key and let it sit refrigerated for at least thirty minutes for the lime to bring out the fresh flavor of all the vegetables. So healthy with no salad dressing.
The best tasting no fat salad I've ever had! It was great about an hour after preparing, but fabulous the next day! Even the kids loved it!

This turned out good especially for hot summer days. I fill like it needed a little something extra. It tasted like exactly the ingredients so I don't know why I expected more. I liked the recipe because it wasn't soaked in a dressing mixture but now I feel like it need some sort of lite dressing or maybe more seasonings.

Cucumber Tomato Red Onion Salad Haiku: "Lovely as written! Cool, colorful, and easy. Lots can be added." Great recipe for a summertime BBQ side dish. Definitely letting it chill in the fridge for several hrs. b4 serving makes it all the better. I've made this many times now, occasionally adding a little EVOO, balsamic vinegar, roasted corn, cumin, black beans -- really, as a base, it's fantastic, but it's equally fun and delicious to make by jazzing it up w/ other goodies.
Very light and refreshing. It would be wonderful as an accompaniment to a spicy dish. I ate it on it's own and thought it could use a little spice.
Very good with spicy food. Didn't use any oil and didn't miss it.
Very simple. I didn't have cilantro so left that out.

I suppose it was ok, if all you want is some cut up cucumbers, tomatoes with some lime juice on your plate. I ended up adding mayo, lemon pepper an parmesan cheese to it to make it more like an actual salad, rathan than just a pile of cut up veggies. I would give it more stars with my additions, but as the recipe is written, only 2 stars. Its really not much of a recipe.
Very good and a nice change from boring old salad...I did as others did and thru in some feta!
I've made this salad and love it, especially on a hot day as a nice side dish. I sometimes add feta cheese to it also

It's about 100 degrees here today, and this is exactly what I want to eat on a day like today. So cool and refreshing! I did add the feta as I served it in the bowl as our son doesn't care for it. Added a few tblspns. of EVOO and just a splash of vinegar but did not have lime. Might add a bit more vinegar. It gets better as it sits in the fridge!
Great healthy recipe! I added diced avocado and a tiny bit of italian dressing! Very quick and easy to make! Thank you for the recipe!
DELICIOUS! I added black beans as others suggested and also some goat cheese and it was SUPERB. I would definitely put in the beans if you have them- it made the salad!

Word to the wise: if you don't like red onions, DON'T use them! I thought I might like this recipe since I love cucumbers and tomatoes but the onions were overpowering. I didn't have cilantro and it might have made a difference. Add extra lime juice!
this was nice and light and something different for a side dish. used for our bbq on the 4th of july this year.. thx!

We make a salad like this using tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, black olives and creamy caesar dressing. It is a delicious side dish with chicken. Or try it on a grilled cheeseburger instead of mayo, lettuce and tomato. It's great!
Great summer salad. Wonderful when everything is fresh from the garden.
This was okay. I am used to using a vinegar base with cucumbers so the lime was just okay. I did not have any red onion so I used regular white onion.
it is very summerlike and tasty
A little plain for me, but a good basic recipe. I added marinated artichokes to add a little something to the dish.

Tomatoes and cucumbers are in abundance here in Japane and have come to love making this salad several times a week. If I serve it to guests they always compliment on how fresh it tastes. Wonderful recipe.
This is a very tasty salad. The first time I made it I thought it was missing something. The second time I added feta cheese and that made the salad for me!
Delicious! We had this at a bridal shower, and it was gone by the end.
Good recipe- fresh & simple. This is good "clean" eating!
yummy! i added feta cheese as well and added olive oil to coat. don't add too much oil though or things will get soggy.
This smells as good as it tastes. Fresh, light and full of flavor. I didn't change a thing. I will make this on a regular basis from now on.

I have to admit I wasn't sure about this at first but on tasting I'm so glad I made it. Everyone loved it, including a teenager. Hubby went back 3 times!! Thanks so much for this. I will be making all summer.
I love this and make it with a can of black beans added to it - drain and rinse the black beans first...
Very, very good. I added just a dollop of my No-Guilt Zesty Ranch Dip for a little creaminess. I don't want to share it's so good!
Wonderful as is. I added feta cheese crumbles.
I've been making this salad for I long as I remember, although I've used lemon instead of lime. Another dressing variation is to add a splash of olive oil mixed with some garlic powder (to taste).

This is a nice, light & refreshing salad. I followed the recipe as written, and I didn't seem to taste any of the lime. Next time I will use the juice of 2 or maybe 3 limes. This salad would compliment grilled meats, chicken or fish very well, along with the other sides in a meal. This adds a nice touch to the plate, and it's fat free too! A splash of balsamic or red wine vinegar would be great also. Thanks (:
This is a great recipe! To change things up I use tomato, cucumber, red onion, feta cheese and a little italian dressing.
Loved this salad. Used as a side dish with grilled chicken. Best part, zero fat!
I looove this recipe.. I usually add avocados and feta too. Maybe olives. And balsamic vinigrette dressing, or oil/vinegar.. So good! Never tried the lime juice or cilantro though.. Next time.
Incredibly fresh and delicious and oh so easy! This is my new favorite salad and I will make it often, exactly as written.

Very simple and refreshing recipe. I made it as a side for homemade falafel & pork souvlaki. We like our food spicy so this was perfect! Made exactly as written except used sea salt. Will definitely make again.

item.name: Cucumber, Tomato, and Red Onion Salad
